30#include "hb-buffer.hh"
31#include "hb-utf.hh"

33
34/**
35 * SECTION: hb-buffer
36 * @title: hb-buffer
37 * @short_description: Input and output buffers
38 * @include: hb.h
39 *
40 * Buffers serve a dual role in HarfBuzz; before shaping, they hold
41 * the input characters that are passed to hb_shape(), and after
42 * shaping they hold the output glyphs.
43 **/
44
45
46/**
47 * hb_segment_properties_equal:
48 * @a: first #hb_segment_properties_t to compare.
49 * @b: second #hb_segment_properties_t to compare.
50 *
51 * Checks the equality of two #hb_segment_properties_t's.
52 *
53 * Return value:
54 * `true` if all properties of @a equal those of @b, `false` otherwise.
55 *
56 * Since: 0.9.7
57 **/
58hb_bool_t
59hb_segment_properties_equal (const hb_segment_properties_t *a,
60 const hb_segment_properties_t *b)
61{
62 return a->direction == b->direction &&
63 a->script == b->script &&
64 a->language == b->language &&
65 a->reserved1 == b->reserved1 &&
66 a->reserved2 == b->reserved2;
67
68}
69
70/**
71 * hb_segment_properties_hash:
72 * @p: #hb_segment_properties_t to hash.
73 *
74 * Creates a hash representing @p.
75 *
76 * Return value:
77 * A hash of @p.
78 *
79 * Since: 0.9.7
80 **/
81unsigned int
82hb_segment_properties_hash (const hb_segment_properties_t *p)
83{
84 return ((unsigned int) p->direction * 31 +
85 (unsigned int) p->script) * 31 +
86 (intptr_t) (p->language);
87}
88
89/**
90 * hb_segment_properties_overlay:
91 * @p: #hb_segment_properties_t to fill in.
92 * @src: #hb_segment_properties_t to fill in from.
93 *
94 * Fills in missing fields of @p from @src in a considered manner.
95 *
96 * First, if @p does not have direction set, direction is copied from @src.
97 *
98 * Next, if @p and @src have the same direction (which can be unset), if @p
99 * does not have script set, script is copied from @src.
100 *
101 * Finally, if @p and @src have the same direction and script (which either
102 * can be unset), if @p does not have language set, language is copied from
103 * @src.
104 *
105 * Since: 3.3.0
106 **/
107void
108hb_segment_properties_overlay (hb_segment_properties_t *p,
109 const hb_segment_properties_t *src)
110{
111 if (unlikely (!p || !src))
112 return;
113
114 if (!p->direction)
115 p->direction = src->direction;
116
117 if (p->direction != src->direction)
118 return;
119
120 if (!p->script)
121 p->script = src->script;
122
123 if (p->script != src->script)
124 return;
125
126 if (!p->language)
127 p->language = src->language;
128}
129
130/* Here is how the buffer works internally:
131 *
132 * There are two info pointers: info and out_info. They always have
133 * the same allocated size, but different lengths.
134 *
135 * As an optimization, both info and out_info may point to the
136 * same piece of memory, which is owned by info. This remains the
137 * case as long as out_len doesn't exceed i at any time.
138 * In that case, sync() is mostly no-op and the glyph operations
139 * operate mostly in-place.
140 *
141 * As soon as out_info gets longer than info, out_info is moved over
142 * to an alternate buffer (which we reuse the pos buffer for), and its
143 * current contents (out_len entries) are copied to the new place.
144 *
145 * This should all remain transparent to the user. sync() then
146 * switches info over to out_info and does housekeeping.
147 */
148
149
150
151/* Internal API */
152
153bool
154hb_buffer_t::enlarge (unsigned int size)
155{
156 if (unlikely (!successful))
157 return false;
158 if (unlikely (size > max_len))
159 {
160 successful = false;
161 return false;
162 }
163
164 unsigned int new_allocated = allocated;
165 hb_glyph_position_t *new_pos = nullptr;
166 hb_glyph_info_t *new_info = nullptr;
167 bool separate_out = out_info != info;
168
169 if (unlikely (hb_unsigned_mul_overflows (size, sizeof (info[0]))))
170 goto done;
171
172 while (size >= new_allocated)
173 new_allocated += (new_allocated >> 1) + 32;
174
175 unsigned new_bytes;
176 if (unlikely (hb_unsigned_mul_overflows (new_allocated, sizeof (info[0]), &new_bytes)))
177 goto done;
178
179 static_assert (sizeof (info[0]) == sizeof (pos[0]), "");
180 new_pos = (hb_glyph_position_t *) hb_realloc (ptr: pos, size: new_bytes);
181 new_info = (hb_glyph_info_t *) hb_realloc (ptr: info, size: new_bytes);
182
183done:
184 if (unlikely (!new_pos || !new_info))
185 successful = false;
186
187 if (likely (new_pos))
188 pos = new_pos;
189
190 if (likely (new_info))
191 info = new_info;
192
193 out_info = separate_out ? (hb_glyph_info_t *) pos : info;
194 if (likely (successful))
195 allocated = new_allocated;
196
197 return likely (successful);
198}
199
200bool
201hb_buffer_t::make_room_for (unsigned int num_in,
202 unsigned int num_out)
203{
204 if (unlikely (!ensure (out_len + num_out))) return false;
205
206 if (out_info == info &&
207 out_len + num_out > idx + num_in)
208 {
209 assert (have_output);
210
211 out_info = (hb_glyph_info_t *) pos;
212 hb_memcpy (dst: out_info, src: info, len: out_len * sizeof (out_info[0]));
213 }
214
215 return true;
216}
217
218bool
219hb_buffer_t::shift_forward (unsigned int count)
220{
221 assert (have_output);
222 if (unlikely (!ensure (len + count))) return false;
223
224 memmove (dest: info + idx + count, src: info + idx, n: (len - idx) * sizeof (info[0]));
225 if (idx + count > len)
226 {
227 /* Under memory failure we might expose this area. At least
228 * clean it up. Oh well...
229 *
230 * Ideally, we should at least set Default_Ignorable bits on
231 * these, as well as consistent cluster values. But the former
232 * is layering violation... */
233 hb_memset (s: info + len, c: 0, n: (idx + count - len) * sizeof (info[0]));
234 }
235 len += count;
236 idx += count;
237
238 return true;
239}
240
241hb_buffer_t::scratch_buffer_t *
242hb_buffer_t::get_scratch_buffer (unsigned int *size)
243{
244 have_output = false;
245 have_positions = false;
246
247 out_len = 0;
248 out_info = info;
249
250 assert ((uintptr_t) pos % sizeof (scratch_buffer_t) == 0);
251 *size = allocated * sizeof (pos[0]) / sizeof (scratch_buffer_t);
252 return (scratch_buffer_t *) (void *) pos;
253}
254

256
257/* HarfBuzz-Internal API */
258
259void
260hb_buffer_t::similar (const hb_buffer_t &src)
261{
262 hb_unicode_funcs_destroy (ufuncs: unicode);
263 unicode = hb_unicode_funcs_reference (ufuncs: src.unicode);
264 flags = src.flags;
265 cluster_level = src.cluster_level;
266 replacement = src.invisible;
267 invisible = src.invisible;
268 not_found = src.not_found;
269}
270
271void
272hb_buffer_t::reset ()
273{
274 hb_unicode_funcs_destroy (ufuncs: unicode);
275 unicode = hb_unicode_funcs_reference (ufuncs: hb_unicode_funcs_get_default ());
276 flags = HB_BUFFER_FLAG_DEFAULT;
277 cluster_level = HB_BUFFER_CLUSTER_LEVEL_DEFAULT;
278 replacement = HB_BUFFER_REPLACEMENT_CODEPOINT_DEFAULT;
279 invisible = 0;
280 not_found = 0;
281
282 clear ();
283}
284
285void
286hb_buffer_t::clear ()
287{
288 content_type = HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_INVALID;
289 hb_segment_properties_t default_props = HB_SEGMENT_PROPERTIES_DEFAULT;
290 props = default_props;
291
292 successful = true;
293 shaping_failed = false;
294 have_output = false;
295 have_positions = false;
296
297 idx = 0;
298 len = 0;
299 out_len = 0;
300 out_info = info;
301
302 hb_memset (s: context, c: 0, n: sizeof context);
303 hb_memset (s: context_len, c: 0, n: sizeof context_len);
304
305 deallocate_var_all ();
306 serial = 0;
307 scratch_flags = HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_DEFAULT;
308}
309
310void
311hb_buffer_t::enter ()
312{
313 deallocate_var_all ();
314 serial = 0;
315 shaping_failed = false;
316 scratch_flags = HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_DEFAULT;
317 unsigned mul;
318 if (likely (!hb_unsigned_mul_overflows (len, HB_BUFFER_MAX_LEN_FACTOR, &mul)))
319 {
320 max_len = hb_max (mul, (unsigned) HB_BUFFER_MAX_LEN_MIN);
321 }
322 if (likely (!hb_unsigned_mul_overflows (len, HB_BUFFER_MAX_OPS_FACTOR, &mul)))
323 {
324 max_ops = hb_max (mul, (unsigned) HB_BUFFER_MAX_OPS_MIN);
325 }
326}
327void
328hb_buffer_t::leave ()
329{
330 max_len = HB_BUFFER_MAX_LEN_DEFAULT;
331 max_ops = HB_BUFFER_MAX_OPS_DEFAULT;
332 deallocate_var_all ();
333 serial = 0;
334 // Intentionally not reseting shaping_failed, such that it can be inspected.
335}
336
337
338void
339hb_buffer_t::add (hb_codepoint_t codepoint,
340 unsigned int cluster)
341{
342 hb_glyph_info_t *glyph;
343
344 if (unlikely (!ensure (len + 1))) return;
345
346 glyph = &info[len];
347
348 hb_memset (s: glyph, c: 0, n: sizeof (*glyph));
349 glyph->codepoint = codepoint;
350 glyph->mask = 0;
351 glyph->cluster = cluster;
352
353 len++;
354}
355
356void
357hb_buffer_t::add_info (const hb_glyph_info_t &glyph_info)
358{
359 if (unlikely (!ensure (len + 1))) return;
360
361 info[len] = glyph_info;
362
363 len++;
364}
365
366
367void
368hb_buffer_t::clear_output ()
369{
370 have_output = true;
371 have_positions = false;
372
373 idx = 0;
374 out_len = 0;
375 out_info = info;
376}
377
378void
379hb_buffer_t::clear_positions ()
380{
381 have_output = false;
382 have_positions = true;
383
384 out_len = 0;
385 out_info = info;
386
387 hb_memset (s: pos, c: 0, n: sizeof (pos[0]) * len);
388}
389
390bool
391hb_buffer_t::sync ()
392{
393 bool ret = false;
394
395 assert (have_output);
396
397 assert (idx <= len);
398
399 if (unlikely (!successful || !next_glyphs (len - idx)))
400 goto reset;
401
402 if (out_info != info)
403 {
404 pos = (hb_glyph_position_t *) info;
405 info = out_info;
406 }
407 len = out_len;
408 ret = true;
409
410reset:
411 have_output = false;
412 out_len = 0;
413 out_info = info;
414 idx = 0;
415
416 return ret;
417}
418
419int
420hb_buffer_t::sync_so_far ()
421{
422 bool had_output = have_output;
423 unsigned out_i = out_len;
424 unsigned i = idx;
425 unsigned old_idx = idx;
426
427 if (sync ())
428 idx = out_i;
429 else
430 idx = i;
431
432 if (had_output)
433 {
434 have_output = true;
435 out_len = idx;
436 }
437
438 assert (idx <= len);
439
440 return idx - old_idx;
441}
442
443bool
444hb_buffer_t::move_to (unsigned int i)
445{
446 if (!have_output)
447 {
448 assert (i <= len);
449 idx = i;
450 return true;
451 }
452 if (unlikely (!successful))
453 return false;
454
455 assert (i <= out_len + (len - idx));
456
457 if (out_len < i)
458 {
459 unsigned int count = i - out_len;
460 if (unlikely (!make_room_for (count, count))) return false;
461
462 memmove (dest: out_info + out_len, src: info + idx, n: count * sizeof (out_info[0]));
463 idx += count;
464 out_len += count;
465 }
466 else if (out_len > i)
467 {
468 /* Tricky part: rewinding... */
469 unsigned int count = out_len - i;
470
471 /* This will blow in our face if memory allocation fails later
472 * in this same lookup...
473 *
474 * We used to shift with extra 32 items.
475 * But that would leave empty slots in the buffer in case of allocation
476 * failures. See comments in shift_forward(). This can cause O(N^2)
477 * behavior more severely than adding 32 empty slots can... */
478 if (unlikely (idx < count && !shift_forward (count - idx))) return false;
479
480 assert (idx >= count);
481
482 idx -= count;
483 out_len -= count;
484 memmove (dest: info + idx, src: out_info + out_len, n: count * sizeof (out_info[0]));
485 }
486
487 return true;
488}
489
490
491void
492hb_buffer_t::set_masks (hb_mask_t value,
493 hb_mask_t mask,
494 unsigned int cluster_start,
495 unsigned int cluster_end)
496{
497 hb_mask_t not_mask = ~mask;
498 value &= mask;
499
500 if (!mask)
501 return;
502
503 unsigned int count = len;
504 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
505 if (cluster_start <= info[i].cluster && info[i].cluster < cluster_end)
506 info[i].mask = (info[i].mask & not_mask) | value;
507}
508
509void
510hb_buffer_t::merge_clusters_impl (unsigned int start,
511 unsigned int end)
512{
513 if (cluster_level == HB_BUFFER_CLUSTER_LEVEL_CHARACTERS)
514 {
515 unsafe_to_break (start, end);
516 return;
517 }
518
519 unsigned int cluster = info[start].cluster;
520
521 for (unsigned int i = start + 1; i < end; i++)
522 cluster = hb_min (cluster, info[i].cluster);
523
524 /* Extend end */
525 if (cluster != info[end - 1].cluster)
526 while (end < len && info[end - 1].cluster == info[end].cluster)
527 end++;
528
529 /* Extend start */
530 if (cluster != info[start].cluster)
531 while (idx < start && info[start - 1].cluster == info[start].cluster)
532 start--;
533
534 /* If we hit the start of buffer, continue in out-buffer. */
535 if (idx == start && info[start].cluster != cluster)
536 for (unsigned int i = out_len; i && out_info[i - 1].cluster == info[start].cluster; i--)
537 set_cluster (inf&: out_info[i - 1], cluster);
538
539 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
540 set_cluster (inf&: info[i], cluster);
541}
542void
543hb_buffer_t::merge_out_clusters (unsigned int start,
544 unsigned int end)
545{
546 if (cluster_level == HB_BUFFER_CLUSTER_LEVEL_CHARACTERS)
547 return;
548
549 if (unlikely (end - start < 2))
550 return;
551
552 unsigned int cluster = out_info[start].cluster;
553
554 for (unsigned int i = start + 1; i < end; i++)
555 cluster = hb_min (cluster, out_info[i].cluster);
556
557 /* Extend start */
558 while (start && out_info[start - 1].cluster == out_info[start].cluster)
559 start--;
560
561 /* Extend end */
562 while (end < out_len && out_info[end - 1].cluster == out_info[end].cluster)
563 end++;
564
565 /* If we hit the end of out-buffer, continue in buffer. */
566 if (end == out_len)
567 for (unsigned int i = idx; i < len && info[i].cluster == out_info[end - 1].cluster; i++)
568 set_cluster (inf&: info[i], cluster);
569
570 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
571 set_cluster (inf&: out_info[i], cluster);
572}
573void
574hb_buffer_t::delete_glyph ()
575{
576 /* The logic here is duplicated in hb_ot_hide_default_ignorables(). */
577
578 unsigned int cluster = info[idx].cluster;
579 if ((idx + 1 < len && cluster == info[idx + 1].cluster) ||
580 (out_len && cluster == out_info[out_len - 1].cluster))
581 {
582 /* Cluster survives; do nothing. */
583 goto done;
584 }
585
586 if (out_len)
587 {
588 /* Merge cluster backward. */
589 if (cluster < out_info[out_len - 1].cluster)
590 {
591 unsigned int mask = info[idx].mask;
592 unsigned int old_cluster = out_info[out_len - 1].cluster;
593 for (unsigned i = out_len; i && out_info[i - 1].cluster == old_cluster; i--)
594 set_cluster (inf&: out_info[i - 1], cluster, mask);
595 }
596 goto done;
597 }
598
599 if (idx + 1 < len)
600 {
601 /* Merge cluster forward. */
602 merge_clusters (start: idx, end: idx + 2);
603 goto done;
604 }
605
606done:
607 skip_glyph ();
608}
609
610void
611hb_buffer_t::delete_glyphs_inplace (bool (*filter) (const hb_glyph_info_t *info))
612{
613 /* Merge clusters and delete filtered glyphs.
614 * NOTE! We can't use out-buffer as we have positioning data. */
615 unsigned int j = 0;
616 unsigned int count = len;
617 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
618 {
619 if (filter (&info[i]))
620 {
621 /* Merge clusters.
622 * Same logic as delete_glyph(), but for in-place removal. */
623
624 unsigned int cluster = info[i].cluster;
625 if (i + 1 < count && cluster == info[i + 1].cluster)
626 continue; /* Cluster survives; do nothing. */
627
628 if (j)
629 {
630 /* Merge cluster backward. */
631 if (cluster < info[j - 1].cluster)
632 {
633 unsigned int mask = info[i].mask;
634 unsigned int old_cluster = info[j - 1].cluster;
635 for (unsigned k = j; k && info[k - 1].cluster == old_cluster; k--)
636 set_cluster (inf&: info[k - 1], cluster, mask);
637 }
638 continue;
639 }
640
641 if (i + 1 < count)
642 merge_clusters (start: i, end: i + 2); /* Merge cluster forward. */
643
644 continue;
645 }
646
647 if (j != i)
648 {
649 info[j] = info[i];
650 pos[j] = pos[i];
651 }
652 j++;
653 }
654 len = j;
655}
656
657void
658hb_buffer_t::guess_segment_properties ()
659{
660 assert_unicode ();
661
662 /* If script is set to INVALID, guess from buffer contents */
663 if (props.script == HB_SCRIPT_INVALID) {
664 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
665 hb_script_t script = unicode->script (unicode: info[i].codepoint);
666 if (likely (script != HB_SCRIPT_COMMON &&
667 script != HB_SCRIPT_INHERITED &&
668 script != HB_SCRIPT_UNKNOWN)) {
669 props.script = script;
670 break;
671 }
672 }
673 }
674
675 /* If direction is set to INVALID, guess from script */
676 if (props.direction == HB_DIRECTION_INVALID) {
677 props.direction = hb_script_get_horizontal_direction (script: props.script);
678 if (props.direction == HB_DIRECTION_INVALID)
679 props.direction = HB_DIRECTION_LTR;
680 }
681
682 /* If language is not set, use default language from locale */
683 if (props.language == HB_LANGUAGE_INVALID) {
684 /* TODO get_default_for_script? using $LANGUAGE */
685 props.language = hb_language_get_default ();
686 }
687}
688
689
690/* Public API */
691
692DEFINE_NULL_INSTANCE (hb_buffer_t) =
693{
694 HB_OBJECT_HEADER_STATIC,
695
696 .unicode: const_cast<hb_unicode_funcs_t *> (&_hb_Null_hb_unicode_funcs_t),
697 .flags: HB_BUFFER_FLAG_DEFAULT,
698 .cluster_level: HB_BUFFER_CLUSTER_LEVEL_DEFAULT,
699 HB_BUFFER_REPLACEMENT_CODEPOINT_DEFAULT,
700 .invisible: 0, /* invisible */
701 .not_found: 0, /* not_found */
702
703
704 .content_type: HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_INVALID,
705 HB_SEGMENT_PROPERTIES_DEFAULT,
706
707 .successful: false, /* successful */
708 .shaping_failed: true, /* shaping_failed */
709 .have_output: false, /* have_output */
710 .have_positions: true /* have_positions */
711
712 /* Zero is good enough for everything else. */
713};
714
715
716/**
717 * hb_buffer_create:
718 *
719 * Creates a new #hb_buffer_t with all properties to defaults.
720 *
721 * Return value: (transfer full):
722 * A newly allocated #hb_buffer_t with a reference count of 1. The initial
723 * reference count should be released with hb_buffer_destroy() when you are done
724 * using the #hb_buffer_t. This function never returns `NULL`. If memory cannot
725 * be allocated, a special #hb_buffer_t object will be returned on which
726 * hb_buffer_allocation_successful() returns `false`.
727 *
728 * Since: 0.9.2
729 **/
730hb_buffer_t *
731hb_buffer_create ()
732{
733 hb_buffer_t *buffer;
734
735 if (!(buffer = hb_object_create<hb_buffer_t> ()))
736 return hb_buffer_get_empty ();
737
738 buffer->max_len = HB_BUFFER_MAX_LEN_DEFAULT;
739 buffer->max_ops = HB_BUFFER_MAX_OPS_DEFAULT;
740
741 buffer->reset ();
742
743 return buffer;
744}
745
746/**
747 * hb_buffer_create_similar:
748 * @src: An #hb_buffer_t
749 *
750 * Creates a new #hb_buffer_t, similar to hb_buffer_create(). The only
751 * difference is that the buffer is configured similarly to @src.
752 *
753 * Return value: (transfer full):
754 * A newly allocated #hb_buffer_t, similar to hb_buffer_create().
755 *
756 * Since: 3.3.0
757 **/
758hb_buffer_t *
759hb_buffer_create_similar (const hb_buffer_t *src)
760{
761 hb_buffer_t *buffer = hb_buffer_create ();
762
763 buffer->similar (src: *src);
764
765 return buffer;
766}
767
768/**
769 * hb_buffer_reset:
770 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
771 *
772 * Resets the buffer to its initial status, as if it was just newly created
773 * with hb_buffer_create().
774 *
775 * Since: 0.9.2
776 **/
777void
778hb_buffer_reset (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
779{
780 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
781 return;
782
783 buffer->reset ();
784}
785
786/**
787 * hb_buffer_get_empty:
788 *
789 * Fetches an empty #hb_buffer_t.
790 *
791 * Return value: (transfer full): The empty buffer
792 *
793 * Since: 0.9.2
794 **/
795hb_buffer_t *
796hb_buffer_get_empty ()
797{
798 return const_cast<hb_buffer_t *> (&Null (hb_buffer_t));
799}
800
801/**
802 * hb_buffer_reference: (skip)
803 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
804 *
805 * Increases the reference count on @buffer by one. This prevents @buffer from
806 * being destroyed until a matching call to hb_buffer_destroy() is made.
807 *
808 * Return value: (transfer full):
809 * The referenced #hb_buffer_t.
810 *
811 * Since: 0.9.2
812 **/
813hb_buffer_t *
814hb_buffer_reference (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
815{
816 return hb_object_reference (obj: buffer);
817}
818
819/**
820 * hb_buffer_destroy: (skip)
821 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
822 *
823 * Deallocate the @buffer.
824 * Decreases the reference count on @buffer by one. If the result is zero, then
825 * @buffer and all associated resources are freed. See hb_buffer_reference().
826 *
827 * Since: 0.9.2
828 **/
829void
830hb_buffer_destroy (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
831{
832 if (!hb_object_destroy (obj: buffer)) return;
833
834 hb_unicode_funcs_destroy (ufuncs: buffer->unicode);
835
836 hb_free (ptr: buffer->info);
837 hb_free (ptr: buffer->pos);
838#ifndef HB_NO_BUFFER_MESSAGE
839 if (buffer->message_destroy)
840 buffer->message_destroy (buffer->message_data);
841#endif
842
843 hb_free (ptr: buffer);
844}
845

847 * hb_buffer_set_user_data: (skip)

849 * @key: The user-data key
850 * @data: A pointer to the user data
851 * @destroy: (nullable): A callback to call when @data is not needed anymore
852 * @replace: Whether to replace an existing data with the same key
853 *
854 * Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the specified buffer.

859 **/

863 void * data,
864 hb_destroy_func_t destroy,
865 hb_bool_t replace)
866{

868}

889
890/**
891 * hb_buffer_set_content_type:
892 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
893 * @content_type: The type of buffer contents to set
894 *
895 * Sets the type of @buffer contents. Buffers are either empty, contain
896 * characters (before shaping), or contain glyphs (the result of shaping).
897 *
898 * You rarely need to call this function, since a number of other
899 * functions transition the content type for you. Namely:
900 *
901 * - A newly created buffer starts with content type
902 * %HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_INVALID. Calling hb_buffer_reset(),
903 * hb_buffer_clear_contents(), as well as calling hb_buffer_set_length()
904 * with an argument of zero all set the buffer content type to invalid
905 * as well.
906 *
907 * - Calling hb_buffer_add_utf8(), hb_buffer_add_utf16(),
908 * hb_buffer_add_utf32(), hb_buffer_add_codepoints() and
909 * hb_buffer_add_latin1() expect that buffer is either empty and
910 * have a content type of invalid, or that buffer content type is
911 * %HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_UNICODE, and they also set the content
912 * type to Unicode if they added anything to an empty buffer.
913 *
914 * - Finally hb_shape() and hb_shape_full() expect that the buffer
915 * is either empty and have content type of invalid, or that buffer
916 * content type is %HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_UNICODE, and upon
917 * success they set the buffer content type to
918 * %HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_GLYPHS.
919 *
920 * The above transitions are designed such that one can use a buffer
921 * in a loop of "reset : add-text : shape" without needing to ever
922 * modify the content type manually.
923 *
924 * Since: 0.9.5
925 **/
926void
927hb_buffer_set_content_type (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
928 hb_buffer_content_type_t content_type)
929{
930 buffer->content_type = content_type;
931}
932
933/**
934 * hb_buffer_get_content_type:
935 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
936 *
937 * Fetches the type of @buffer contents. Buffers are either empty, contain
938 * characters (before shaping), or contain glyphs (the result of shaping).
939 *
940 * Return value:
941 * The type of @buffer contents
942 *
943 * Since: 0.9.5
944 **/
945hb_buffer_content_type_t
946hb_buffer_get_content_type (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)
947{
948 return buffer->content_type;
949}

953 * hb_buffer_set_unicode_funcs:
954 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t

958 * @unicode_funcs.

965{

967 return;

974 buffer->unicode = unicode_funcs;
975}

993/**
994 * hb_buffer_set_direction:
995 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
996 * @direction: the #hb_direction_t of the @buffer
997 *
998 * Set the text flow direction of the buffer. No shaping can happen without
999 * setting @buffer direction, and it controls the visual direction for the
1000 * output glyphs; for RTL direction the glyphs will be reversed. Many layout
1001 * features depend on the proper setting of the direction, for example,
1002 * reversing RTL text before shaping, then shaping with LTR direction is not
1003 * the same as keeping the text in logical order and shaping with RTL
1004 * direction.
1005 *
1006 * Since: 0.9.2
1007 **/
1008void
1009hb_buffer_set_direction (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1010 hb_direction_t direction)
1011{
1012 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
1013 return;
1014
1015 buffer->props.direction = direction;
1016}
1017
1018/**
1019 * hb_buffer_get_direction:
1020 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1021 *
1022 * See hb_buffer_set_direction()
1023 *
1024 * Return value:
1025 * The direction of the @buffer.
1026 *
1027 * Since: 0.9.2
1028 **/
1029hb_direction_t
1030hb_buffer_get_direction (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1031{
1032 return buffer->props.direction;
1033}

1035/**
1036 * hb_buffer_set_script:
1037 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1038 * @script: An #hb_script_t to set.
1039 *
1040 * Sets the script of @buffer to @script.
1041 *
1042 * Script is crucial for choosing the proper shaping behaviour for scripts that
1043 * require it (e.g. Arabic) and the which OpenType features defined in the font
1044 * to be applied.
1045 *
1046 * You can pass one of the predefined #hb_script_t values, or use
1047 * hb_script_from_string() or hb_script_from_iso15924_tag() to get the
1048 * corresponding script from an ISO 15924 script tag.
1049 *
1050 * Since: 0.9.2
1051 **/
1052void
1053hb_buffer_set_script (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1054 hb_script_t script)
1055{
1056 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
1057 return;
1058
1059 buffer->props.script = script;
1060}

1063 * hb_buffer_get_script:
1064 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1065 *
1066 * Fetches the script of @buffer.
1067 *
1068 * Return value:
1069 * The #hb_script_t of the @buffer
1070 *
1071 * Since: 0.9.2
1072 **/
1073hb_script_t
1074hb_buffer_get_script (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)

1076 return buffer->props.script;
1077}

1079/**
1080 * hb_buffer_set_language:
1081 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1082 * @language: An hb_language_t to set
1083 *
1084 * Sets the language of @buffer to @language.
1085 *
1086 * Languages are crucial for selecting which OpenType feature to apply to the
1087 * buffer which can result in applying language-specific behaviour. Languages
1088 * are orthogonal to the scripts, and though they are related, they are
1089 * different concepts and should not be confused with each other.
1090 *
1091 * Use hb_language_from_string() to convert from BCP 47 language tags to
1092 * #hb_language_t.
1093 *
1094 * Since: 0.9.2
1095 **/
1096void
1097hb_buffer_set_language (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1098 hb_language_t language)
1099{
1100 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
1101 return;
1102
1103 buffer->props.language = language;
1104}
1105
1106/**
1107 * hb_buffer_get_language:

1110 * See hb_buffer_set_language().

1113 * The #hb_language_t of the buffer. Must not be freed by the caller.
1114 *
1115 * Since: 0.9.2
1116 **/
1117hb_language_t
1118hb_buffer_get_language (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1119{
1120 return buffer->props.language;
1121}

1411/**
1412 * hb_buffer_add:
1413 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1414 * @codepoint: A Unicode code point.
1415 * @cluster: The cluster value of @codepoint.
1416 *
1417 * Appends a character with the Unicode value of @codepoint to @buffer, and
1418 * gives it the initial cluster value of @cluster. Clusters can be any thing
1419 * the client wants, they are usually used to refer to the index of the
1420 * character in the input text stream and are output in
1421 * #hb_glyph_info_t.cluster field.
1422 *
1423 * This function does not check the validity of @codepoint, it is up to the
1424 * caller to ensure it is a valid Unicode code point.
1425 *
1426 * Since: 0.9.7
1427 **/
1428void
1429hb_buffer_add (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1430 hb_codepoint_t codepoint,
1431 unsigned int cluster)
1432{
1433 buffer->add (codepoint, cluster);
1434 buffer->clear_context (side: 1);
1435}
1436
1437/**
1438 * hb_buffer_set_length:
1439 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1440 * @length: The new length of @buffer
1441 *
1442 * Similar to hb_buffer_pre_allocate(), but clears any new items added at the
1443 * end.
1444 *
1445 * Return value:
1446 * `true` if @buffer memory allocation succeeded, `false` otherwise.
1447 *
1448 * Since: 0.9.2
1449 **/
1450hb_bool_t
1451hb_buffer_set_length (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1452 unsigned int length)
1453{
1454 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
1455 return length == 0;
1456
1457 if (unlikely (!buffer->ensure (length)))
1458 return false;
1459
1460 /* Wipe the new space */
1461 if (length > buffer->len) {
1462 hb_memset (s: buffer->info + buffer->len, c: 0, n: sizeof (buffer->info[0]) * (length - buffer->len));
1463 if (buffer->have_positions)
1464 hb_memset (s: buffer->pos + buffer->len, c: 0, n: sizeof (buffer->pos[0]) * (length - buffer->len));
1465 }
1466
1467 buffer->len = length;
1468
1469 if (!length)
1470 {
1471 buffer->content_type = HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_INVALID;
1472 buffer->clear_context (side: 0);
1473 }
1474 buffer->clear_context (side: 1);
1475
1476 return true;
1477}
1478
1479/**
1480 * hb_buffer_get_length:
1481 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1482 *
1483 * Returns the number of items in the buffer.
1484 *
1485 * Return value:
1486 * The @buffer length.
1487 * The value valid as long as buffer has not been modified.
1488 *
1489 * Since: 0.9.2
1490 **/
1491unsigned int
1492hb_buffer_get_length (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1493{
1494 return buffer->len;
1495}
1496
1497/**
1498 * hb_buffer_get_glyph_infos:
1499 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1500 * @length: (out): The output-array length.
1501 *
1502 * Returns @buffer glyph information array. Returned pointer
1503 * is valid as long as @buffer contents are not modified.
1504 *
1505 * Return value: (transfer none) (array length=length):
1506 * The @buffer glyph information array.
1507 * The value valid as long as buffer has not been modified.
1508 *
1509 * Since: 0.9.2
1510 **/
1511hb_glyph_info_t *
1512hb_buffer_get_glyph_infos (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1513 unsigned int *length)
1514{
1515 if (length)
1516 *length = buffer->len;
1517
1518 return (hb_glyph_info_t *) buffer->info;
1519}
1520
1521/**
1522 * hb_buffer_get_glyph_positions:
1523 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1524 * @length: (out): The output length
1525 *
1526 * Returns @buffer glyph position array. Returned pointer
1527 * is valid as long as @buffer contents are not modified.
1528 *
1529 * If buffer did not have positions before, the positions will be
1530 * initialized to zeros, unless this function is called from
1531 * within a buffer message callback (see hb_buffer_set_message_func()),
1532 * in which case `NULL` is returned.
1533 *
1534 * Return value: (transfer none) (array length=length):
1535 * The @buffer glyph position array.
1536 * The value valid as long as buffer has not been modified.
1537 *
1538 * Since: 0.9.2
1539 **/
1540hb_glyph_position_t *
1541hb_buffer_get_glyph_positions (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1542 unsigned int *length)
1543{
1544 if (length)
1545 *length = buffer->len;
1546
1547 if (!buffer->have_positions)
1548 {
1549 if (unlikely (buffer->message_depth))
1550 return nullptr;
1551
1552 buffer->clear_positions ();
1553 }
1554
1555 return (hb_glyph_position_t *) buffer->pos;
1556}
1557
1558/**
1559 * hb_buffer_has_positions:
1560 * @buffer: an #hb_buffer_t.
1561 *
1562 * Returns whether @buffer has glyph position data.
1563 * A buffer gains position data when hb_buffer_get_glyph_positions() is called on it,
1564 * and cleared of position data when hb_buffer_clear_contents() is called.
1565 *
1566 * Return value:
1567 * `true` if the @buffer has position array, `false` otherwise.
1568 *
1569 * Since: 2.7.3
1570 **/
1571HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
1572hb_buffer_has_positions (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1573{
1574 return buffer->have_positions;
1575}

1641/**
1642 * hb_buffer_guess_segment_properties:
1643 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1644 *
1645 * Sets unset buffer segment properties based on buffer Unicode
1646 * contents. If buffer is not empty, it must have content type
1647 * #HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_UNICODE.
1648 *
1649 * If buffer script is not set (ie. is #HB_SCRIPT_INVALID), it
1650 * will be set to the Unicode script of the first character in
1651 * the buffer that has a script other than #HB_SCRIPT_COMMON,
1652 * #HB_SCRIPT_INHERITED, and #HB_SCRIPT_UNKNOWN.
1653 *
1654 * Next, if buffer direction is not set (ie. is #HB_DIRECTION_INVALID),
1655 * it will be set to the natural horizontal direction of the
1656 * buffer script as returned by hb_script_get_horizontal_direction().
1657 * If hb_script_get_horizontal_direction() returns #HB_DIRECTION_INVALID,
1658 * then #HB_DIRECTION_LTR is used.
1659 *
1660 * Finally, if buffer language is not set (ie. is #HB_LANGUAGE_INVALID),
1661 * it will be set to the process's default language as returned by
1662 * hb_language_get_default(). This may change in the future by
1663 * taking buffer script into consideration when choosing a language.
1664 * Note that hb_language_get_default() is NOT threadsafe the first time
1665 * it is called. See documentation for that function for details.
1666 *
1667 * Since: 0.9.7
1668 **/
1669void
1670hb_buffer_guess_segment_properties (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1671{
1672 buffer->guess_segment_properties ();
1673}
1674
1675template <typename utf_t>
1676static inline void
1677hb_buffer_add_utf (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1678 const typename utf_t::codepoint_t *text,
1679 int text_length,
1680 unsigned int item_offset,
1681 int item_length)
1682{
1683 typedef typename utf_t::codepoint_t T;
1684 const hb_codepoint_t replacement = buffer->replacement;
1685
1686 buffer->assert_unicode ();
1687
1688 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
1689 return;
1690
1691 if (text_length == -1)
1692 text_length = utf_t::strlen (text);
1693
1694 if (item_length == -1)
1695 item_length = text_length - item_offset;
1696
1697 if (unlikely (item_length < 0 ||
1698 item_length > INT_MAX / 8 ||
1699 !buffer->ensure (buffer->len + item_length * sizeof (T) / 4)))
1700 return;
1701
1702 /* If buffer is empty and pre-context provided, install it.
1703 * This check is written this way, to make sure people can
1704 * provide pre-context in one add_utf() call, then provide
1705 * text in a follow-up call. See:
1706 *
1707 * https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=801410#c13
1708 */
1709 if (!buffer->len && item_offset > 0)
1710 {
1711 /* Add pre-context */
1712 buffer->clear_context (side: 0);
1713 const T *prev = text + item_offset;
1714 const T *start = text;
1715 while (start < prev && buffer->context_len[0] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH)
1716 {
1717 hb_codepoint_t u;
1718 prev = utf_t::prev (prev, start, &u, replacement);
1719 buffer->context[0][buffer->context_len[0]++] = u;
1720 }
1721 }
1722
1723 const T *next = text + item_offset;
1724 const T *end = next + item_length;
1725 while (next < end)
1726 {
1727 hb_codepoint_t u;
1728 const T *old_next = next;
1729 next = utf_t::next (next, end, &u, replacement);
1730 buffer->add (codepoint: u, cluster: old_next - (const T *) text);
1731 }
1732
1733 /* Add post-context */
1734 buffer->clear_context (side: 1);
1735 end = text + text_length;
1736 while (next < end && buffer->context_len[1] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH)
1737 {
1738 hb_codepoint_t u;
1739 next = utf_t::next (next, end, &u, replacement);
1740 buffer->context[1][buffer->context_len[1]++] = u;
1741 }
1742
1743 buffer->content_type = HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_UNICODE;
1744}
1745
1746/**
1747 * hb_buffer_add_utf8:
1748 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1749 * @text: (array length=text_length) (element-type uint8_t): An array of UTF-8
1750 * characters to append.
1751 * @text_length: The length of the @text, or -1 if it is `NULL` terminated.
1752 * @item_offset: The offset of the first character to add to the @buffer.
1753 * @item_length: The number of characters to add to the @buffer, or -1 for the
1754 * end of @text (assuming it is `NULL` terminated).
1755 *
1756 * See hb_buffer_add_codepoints().
1757 *
1758 * Replaces invalid UTF-8 characters with the @buffer replacement code point,
1759 * see hb_buffer_set_replacement_codepoint().
1760 *
1761 * Since: 0.9.2
1762 **/
1763void
1764hb_buffer_add_utf8 (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1765 const char *text,
1766 int text_length,
1767 unsigned int item_offset,
1768 int item_length)
1769{
1770 hb_buffer_add_utf<hb_utf8_t> (buffer, text: (const uint8_t *) text, text_length, item_offset, item_length);
1771}
1772
1773/**
1774 * hb_buffer_add_utf16:

1776 * @text: (array length=text_length): An array of UTF-16 characters to append
1777 * @text_length: The length of the @text, or -1 if it is `NULL` terminated
1778 * @item_offset: The offset of the first character to add to the @buffer
1779 * @item_length: The number of characters to add to the @buffer, or -1 for the
1780 * end of @text (assuming it is `NULL` terminated)
1781 *
1782 * See hb_buffer_add_codepoints().
1783 *
1784 * Replaces invalid UTF-16 characters with the @buffer replacement code point,
1785 * see hb_buffer_set_replacement_codepoint().
1786 *
1787 * Since: 0.9.2
1788 **/
1789void
1790hb_buffer_add_utf16 (hb_buffer_t *buffer,

1799/**
1800 * hb_buffer_add_utf32:
1801 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1802 * @text: (array length=text_length): An array of UTF-32 characters to append
1803 * @text_length: The length of the @text, or -1 if it is `NULL` terminated
1804 * @item_offset: The offset of the first character to add to the @buffer
1805 * @item_length: The number of characters to add to the @buffer, or -1 for the
1806 * end of @text (assuming it is `NULL` terminated)
1807 *
1808 * See hb_buffer_add_codepoints().
1809 *
1810 * Replaces invalid UTF-32 characters with the @buffer replacement code point,
1811 * see hb_buffer_set_replacement_codepoint().
1812 *
1813 * Since: 0.9.2
1814 **/
1815void
1816hb_buffer_add_utf32 (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1817 const uint32_t *text,
1818 int text_length,
1819 unsigned int item_offset,
1820 int item_length)

1824
1825/**
1826 * hb_buffer_add_latin1:
1827 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1828 * @text: (array length=text_length) (element-type uint8_t): an array of UTF-8
1829 * characters to append
1830 * @text_length: the length of the @text, or -1 if it is `NULL` terminated
1831 * @item_offset: the offset of the first character to add to the @buffer
1832 * @item_length: the number of characters to add to the @buffer, or -1 for the
1833 * end of @text (assuming it is `NULL` terminated)
1834 *
1835 * Similar to hb_buffer_add_codepoints(), but allows only access to first 256
1836 * Unicode code points that can fit in 8-bit strings.
1837 *
1838 * <note>Has nothing to do with non-Unicode Latin-1 encoding.</note>
1839 *
1840 * Since: 0.9.39
1841 **/
1842void
1843hb_buffer_add_latin1 (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1844 const uint8_t *text,
1845 int text_length,
1846 unsigned int item_offset,
1847 int item_length)
1848{
1849 hb_buffer_add_utf<hb_latin1_t> (buffer, text, text_length, item_offset, item_length);
1850}
1851
1852/**
1853 * hb_buffer_add_codepoints:
1854 * @buffer: a #hb_buffer_t to append characters to.
1855 * @text: (array length=text_length): an array of Unicode code points to append.
1856 * @text_length: the length of the @text, or -1 if it is `NULL` terminated.
1857 * @item_offset: the offset of the first code point to add to the @buffer.
1858 * @item_length: the number of code points to add to the @buffer, or -1 for the
1859 * end of @text (assuming it is `NULL` terminated).
1860 *
1861 * Appends characters from @text array to @buffer. The @item_offset is the
1862 * position of the first character from @text that will be appended, and
1863 * @item_length is the number of character. When shaping part of a larger text
1864 * (e.g. a run of text from a paragraph), instead of passing just the substring
1865 * corresponding to the run, it is preferable to pass the whole
1866 * paragraph and specify the run start and length as @item_offset and
1867 * @item_length, respectively, to give HarfBuzz the full context to be able,
1868 * for example, to do cross-run Arabic shaping or properly handle combining
1869 * marks at stat of run.
1870 *
1871 * This function does not check the validity of @text, it is up to the caller
1872 * to ensure it contains a valid Unicode scalar values. In contrast,
1873 * hb_buffer_add_utf32() can be used that takes similar input but performs
1874 * sanity-check on the input.
1875 *
1876 * Since: 0.9.31
1877 **/
1878void
1879hb_buffer_add_codepoints (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1880 const hb_codepoint_t *text,
1881 int text_length,
1882 unsigned int item_offset,
1883 int item_length)
1884{
1885 hb_buffer_add_utf<hb_utf32_novalidate_t> (buffer, text, text_length, item_offset, item_length);
1886}
1887
1888
1889/**
1890 * hb_buffer_append:
1891 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
1892 * @source: source #hb_buffer_t
1893 * @start: start index into source buffer to copy. Use 0 to copy from start of buffer.
1894 * @end: end index into source buffer to copy. Use @HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END to copy to end of buffer.
1895 *
1896 * Append (part of) contents of another buffer to this buffer.
1897 *
1898 * Since: 1.5.0
1899 **/
1900HB_EXTERN void
1901hb_buffer_append (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1902 const hb_buffer_t *source,
1903 unsigned int start,
1904 unsigned int end)
1905{
1906 assert (!buffer->have_output && !source->have_output);
1907 assert (buffer->have_positions == source->have_positions ||
1908 !buffer->len || !source->len);
1909 assert (buffer->content_type == source->content_type ||
1910 !buffer->len || !source->len);
1911
1912 if (end > source->len)
1913 end = source->len;
1914 if (start > end)
1915 start = end;
1916 if (start == end)
1917 return;
1918
1919 if (buffer->len + (end - start) < buffer->len) /* Overflows. */
1920 {
1921 buffer->successful = false;
1922 return;
1923 }
1924
1925 unsigned int orig_len = buffer->len;
1926 hb_buffer_set_length (buffer, length: buffer->len + (end - start));
1927 if (unlikely (!buffer->successful))
1928 return;
1929
1930 if (!orig_len)
1931 buffer->content_type = source->content_type;
1932 if (!buffer->have_positions && source->have_positions)
1933 buffer->clear_positions ();
1934
1935 hb_segment_properties_overlay (p: &buffer->props, src: &source->props);
1936
1937 hb_memcpy (dst: buffer->info + orig_len, src: source->info + start, len: (end - start) * sizeof (buffer->info[0]));
1938 if (buffer->have_positions)
1939 hb_memcpy (dst: buffer->pos + orig_len, src: source->pos + start, len: (end - start) * sizeof (buffer->pos[0]));
1940
1941 if (source->content_type == HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_UNICODE)
1942 {
1943 /* See similar logic in add_utf. */
1944
1945 /* pre-context */
1946 if (!orig_len && start + source->context_len[0] > 0)
1947 {
1948 buffer->clear_context (side: 0);
1949 while (start > 0 && buffer->context_len[0] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH)
1950 buffer->context[0][buffer->context_len[0]++] = source->info[--start].codepoint;
1951 for (auto i = 0u; i < source->context_len[0] && buffer->context_len[0] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH; i++)
1952 buffer->context[0][buffer->context_len[0]++] = source->context[0][i];
1953 }
1954
1955 /* post-context */
1956 buffer->clear_context (side: 1);
1957 while (end < source->len && buffer->context_len[1] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH)
1958 buffer->context[1][buffer->context_len[1]++] = source->info[end++].codepoint;
1959 for (auto i = 0u; i < source->context_len[1] && buffer->context_len[1] < buffer->CONTEXT_LENGTH; i++)
1960 buffer->context[1][buffer->context_len[1]++] = source->context[1][i];
1961 }
1962}
1963
1964
1965static int
1966compare_info_codepoint (const hb_glyph_info_t *pa,
1967 const hb_glyph_info_t *pb)
1968{
1969 return (int) pb->codepoint - (int) pa->codepoint;
1970}
1971
1972static inline void
1973normalize_glyphs_cluster (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1974 unsigned int start,
1975 unsigned int end,
1976 bool backward)
1977{
1978 hb_glyph_position_t *pos = buffer->pos;
1979
1980 /* Total cluster advance */
1981 hb_position_t total_x_advance = 0, total_y_advance = 0;
1982 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
1983 {
1984 total_x_advance += pos[i].x_advance;
1985 total_y_advance += pos[i].y_advance;
1986 }
1987
1988 hb_position_t x_advance = 0, y_advance = 0;
1989 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
1990 {
1991 pos[i].x_offset += x_advance;
1992 pos[i].y_offset += y_advance;
1993
1994 x_advance += pos[i].x_advance;
1995 y_advance += pos[i].y_advance;
1996
1997 pos[i].x_advance = 0;
1998 pos[i].y_advance = 0;
1999 }
2000
2001 if (backward)
2002 {
2003 /* Transfer all cluster advance to the last glyph. */
2004 pos[end - 1].x_advance = total_x_advance;
2005 pos[end - 1].y_advance = total_y_advance;
2006
2007 hb_stable_sort (array: buffer->info + start, len: end - start - 1, compar: compare_info_codepoint, array2: buffer->pos + start);
2008 } else {
2009 /* Transfer all cluster advance to the first glyph. */
2010 pos[start].x_advance += total_x_advance;
2011 pos[start].y_advance += total_y_advance;
2012 for (unsigned int i = start + 1; i < end; i++) {
2013 pos[i].x_offset -= total_x_advance;
2014 pos[i].y_offset -= total_y_advance;
2015 }
2016 hb_stable_sort (array: buffer->info + start + 1, len: end - start - 1, compar: compare_info_codepoint, array2: buffer->pos + start + 1);
2017 }
2018}
2019
2020/**
2021 * hb_buffer_normalize_glyphs:
2022 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
2023 *
2024 * Reorders a glyph buffer to have canonical in-cluster glyph order / position.
2025 * The resulting clusters should behave identical to pre-reordering clusters.
2026 *
2027 * <note>This has nothing to do with Unicode normalization.</note>
2028 *
2029 * Since: 0.9.2
2030 **/
2031void
2032hb_buffer_normalize_glyphs (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
2033{
2034 assert (buffer->have_positions);
2035
2036 buffer->assert_glyphs ();
2037
2038 bool backward = HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD (buffer->props.direction);
2039
2040 foreach_cluster (buffer, start, end)
2041 normalize_glyphs_cluster (buffer, start, end, backward);
2042}
2043
2044void
2045hb_buffer_t::sort (unsigned int start, unsigned int end, int(*compar)(const hb_glyph_info_t *, const hb_glyph_info_t *))
2046{
2047 assert (!have_positions);
2048 for (unsigned int i = start + 1; i < end; i++)
2049 {
2050 unsigned int j = i;
2051 while (j > start && compar (&info[j - 1], &info[i]) > 0)
2052 j--;
2053 if (i == j)
2054 continue;
2055 /* Move item i to occupy place for item j, shift what's in between. */
2056 merge_clusters (start: j, end: i + 1);
2057 {
2058 hb_glyph_info_t t = info[i];
2059 memmove (dest: &info[j + 1], src: &info[j], n: (i - j) * sizeof (hb_glyph_info_t));
2060 info[j] = t;
2061 }
2062 }
2063}
2064
2065
2066/*
2067 * Comparing buffers.
2068 */
2069
2070/**
2071 * hb_buffer_diff:
2072 * @buffer: a buffer.
2073 * @reference: other buffer to compare to.
2074 * @dottedcircle_glyph: glyph id of U+25CC DOTTED CIRCLE, or (hb_codepont_t) -1.
2075 * @position_fuzz: allowed absolute difference in position values.
2076 *
2077 * If dottedcircle_glyph is (hb_codepoint_t) -1 then #HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_DOTTED_CIRCLE_PRESENT
2078 * and #HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_NOTDEF_PRESENT are never returned. This should be used by most
2079 * callers if just comparing two buffers is needed.
2080 *
2081 * Since: 1.5.0
2082 **/
2083hb_buffer_diff_flags_t
2084hb_buffer_diff (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
2085 hb_buffer_t *reference,
2086 hb_codepoint_t dottedcircle_glyph,
2087 unsigned int position_fuzz)
2088{
2089 if (buffer->content_type != reference->content_type && buffer->len && reference->len)
2090 return HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_CONTENT_TYPE_MISMATCH;
2091
2092 hb_buffer_diff_flags_t result = HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_EQUAL;
2093 bool contains = dottedcircle_glyph != (hb_codepoint_t) -1;
2094
2095 unsigned int count = reference->len;
2096
2097 if (buffer->len != count)
2098 {
2099 /*
2100 * we can't compare glyph-by-glyph, but we do want to know if there
2101 * are .notdef or dottedcircle glyphs present in the reference buffer
2102 */
2103 const hb_glyph_info_t *info = reference->info;
2104 unsigned int i;
2105 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2106 {
2107 if (contains && info[i].codepoint == dottedcircle_glyph)
2108 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_DOTTED_CIRCLE_PRESENT;
2109 if (contains && info[i].codepoint == 0)
2110 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_NOTDEF_PRESENT;
2111 }
2112 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_LENGTH_MISMATCH;
2113 return hb_buffer_diff_flags_t (result);
2114 }
2115
2116 if (!count)
2117 return hb_buffer_diff_flags_t (result);
2118
2119 const hb_glyph_info_t *buf_info = buffer->info;
2120 const hb_glyph_info_t *ref_info = reference->info;
2121 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
2122 {
2123 if (buf_info->codepoint != ref_info->codepoint)
2124 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_CODEPOINT_MISMATCH;
2125 if (buf_info->cluster != ref_info->cluster)
2126 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_CLUSTER_MISMATCH;
2127 if ((buf_info->mask ^ ref_info->mask) & HB_GLYPH_FLAG_DEFINED)
2128 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_GLYPH_FLAGS_MISMATCH;
2129 if (contains && ref_info->codepoint == dottedcircle_glyph)
2130 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_DOTTED_CIRCLE_PRESENT;
2131 if (contains && ref_info->codepoint == 0)
2132 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_NOTDEF_PRESENT;
2133 buf_info++;
2134 ref_info++;
2135 }
2136
2137 if (buffer->content_type == HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_GLYPHS)
2138 {
2139 assert (buffer->have_positions);
2140 const hb_glyph_position_t *buf_pos = buffer->pos;
2141 const hb_glyph_position_t *ref_pos = reference->pos;
2142 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
2143 {
2144 if ((unsigned int) abs (x: buf_pos->x_advance - ref_pos->x_advance) > position_fuzz ||
2145 (unsigned int) abs (x: buf_pos->y_advance - ref_pos->y_advance) > position_fuzz ||
2146 (unsigned int) abs (x: buf_pos->x_offset - ref_pos->x_offset) > position_fuzz ||
2147 (unsigned int) abs (x: buf_pos->y_offset - ref_pos->y_offset) > position_fuzz)
2148 {
2149 result |= HB_BUFFER_DIFF_FLAG_POSITION_MISMATCH;
2150 break;
2151 }
2152 buf_pos++;
2153 ref_pos++;
2154 }
2155 }
2156
2157 return result;
2158}
2159
2160
2161/*
2162 * Debugging.
2163 */
2164
2165#ifndef HB_NO_BUFFER_MESSAGE
2166/**
2167 * hb_buffer_set_message_func:
2168 * @buffer: An #hb_buffer_t
2169 * @func: (closure user_data) (destroy destroy) (scope notified): Callback function
2170 * @user_data: (nullable): Data to pass to @func
2171 * @destroy: (nullable): The function to call when @user_data is not needed anymore
2172 *
2173 * Sets the implementation function for #hb_buffer_message_func_t.
2174 *
2175 * Since: 1.1.3
2176 **/
2177void
2178hb_buffer_set_message_func (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
2179 hb_buffer_message_func_t func,
2180 void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy)
2181{
2182 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (buffer)))
2183 {
2184 if (destroy)
2185 destroy (user_data);
2186 return;
2187 }
2188
2189 if (buffer->message_destroy)
2190 buffer->message_destroy (buffer->message_data);
2191
2192 if (func) {
2193 buffer->message_func = func;
2194 buffer->message_data = user_data;
2195 buffer->message_destroy = destroy;
2196 } else {
2197 buffer->message_func = nullptr;
2198 buffer->message_data = nullptr;
2199 buffer->message_destroy = nullptr;
2200 }
2201}
2202bool
2203hb_buffer_t::message_impl (hb_font_t *font, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
2204{
2205 assert (!have_output || (out_info == info && out_len == idx));
2206
2207 message_depth++;
2208
2209 char buf[100];
2210 vsnprintf (s: buf, maxlen: sizeof (buf), format: fmt, arg: ap);
2211 bool ret = (bool) this->message_func (this, font, buf, this->message_data);
2212
2213 message_depth--;
2214
2215 return ret;
2216}
